headline.main: What Unhealthy Products Should CVS Stop Selling?

docs.abstract: Seeing itself as a health care company, CVS will stop selling tobacco products. Why stop there?
docs.snippet: Seeing itself as a health care company, CVS will stop selling tobacco products. Why stop there?

headline.main: Think Like a Doctor: Return of the Stomach Bug

docs.abstract: Can you solve a medical mystery involving an elderly woman with a 10-day stomach ailment identical to a problem she suffered four years ago?
docs.snippet: Can you solve a medical mystery involving an elderly woman with a 10-day stomach ailment identical to a problem she suffered four years ago?

docs.lead_paragraph: Merck & Co Inc's quarterly profit and sales just missed expectations as its medicines faced competition from cheaper generics, but the company announced potentially lucrative new cancer-drug partnerships with rival U.S. drugmakers.

headline.main: Merck Results Flag, but Cancer-Drug Deals Lift Shares
headline.print_headline: Merck Results Flag, but Cancer-Drug Deals Lift Shares

docs.snippet: Merck & Co Inc's quarterly profit and sales just missed expectations as its medicines faced competition from cheaper generics, but the company announced potentially lucrative new cancer-drug partnerships with rival U.S. drugmakers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Professors at the University of Colorado write that it is highly unethical for jails to capitalize on inmate addiction.
docs.snippet: Professors at the University of Colorado write that it is highly unethical for jails to capitalize on inmate addiction.

docs.lead_paragraph: Genetic testing of embryos raises unsettling ethical questions that trouble advocates for the disabled and have left some doctors struggling with what they should tell their patients.

headline.main: Ethics Questions Arise as Genetic Testing of Embryos Increases
headline.print_headline: Gene Tests, Healthy Children and Ethical Doubt

docs.abstract: Preimplantation diagnosis, genetic testing of embryos, has soared as methods have improved and more disease-causing genes have been discovered; its use, which makes it possible for couples to ensure their children will not inherit faulty gene, does raise unsettling ethical questions that trouble advocates for the disabled and have left some doctors struggling with what they should tell their patients.
docs.snippet: Genetic testing of embryos raises unsettling ethical questions that trouble advocates for the disabled and have left some doctors struggling with what they should tell their patients.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A research center funded by the Affordable Care Act is being criticized for not using proven methods like clinical trials to learn how to best deliver care.

headline.main: Method of Study Is Criticized in Group’s Health Policy Tests
headline.print_headline: Method of Study Is Criticized in Group’s Health Policy Tests

docs.abstract: Innovation Center, research facility funded by Affordable Care Act, is being criticized by many researchers and economists for not using proven methods like randomized clinical trials to learn how to best deliver health care; experts say center, which undertakes mostly demonstration projects, is squandering crucial opportunity to develop evidence needed to retool nation's troubled health care system.
docs.snippet: A research center funded by the Affordable Care Act is being criticized for not using proven methods like clinical trials to learn how to best deliver care.
